citation.article-title: Dokdonella ginsengisoli sp. nov., isolated from soil from a ginseng field, and emended description of the genus Dokdonell
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Dokdonella ginsengisoli sp. nov.
Dokdonella ginsengisoli (gin.sen.gi.so′li. N.L. n. ginsengum ginseng; L. n. solum soil; N.L. gen. n. ginsengisoli of soil of a ginseng field, the source of the type strain).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, non-spore-forming, non-motile and rod-shaped.
Colonies grown on R2A agar plates for 2 days are smooth, circular, convex and yellowish.
Growth is observed at 15 and 42 °C but not at 4 or 45 °C.
Minimum pH for growth lies between 5.5 and 6.0, optimum pH is 6.5–7.0 and the maximum pH lies between 9.5 and 10.0.
Growth occurs on trypticase soy agar and nutrient agar, but not on MacConkey agar.
Hydrolyses aesculin, gelatin and casein, but not hydroxyethyl cellulose, xylan, chitin, starch or DNA.

The following substrates are utilized for growth: d-glucose, d-fructose, d-lyxose, N-acetylglucosamine, acetate, valerate, lactate, l-aspartate, l-asparagine, l-glutamate, l-glutamine, l-proline, l-serine, l-tryptophan and l-tyrosine.

The following substrates are not utilized for growth: d-galactose, d-mannose, l-fucose, l-rhamnose, l-sorbose, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, d-lactose, maltose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, raffinose, pyruvate, formate, propionate, maleate, fumarate, phenyl acetate, benzoate, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, salicin, caprate, citrate, gluconate, malate, malonate, succinate, glutarate, tartrate, itaconate, adipate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, suberate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, oxalate, suberate, d-adonitol, dulcitol, ethanol, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, xylitol, amygdalin, glycerol, methanol, glycogen, inulin, dextran, l-alanine, l-cysteine, glycine, l-histidine, l-isoleucine, l-leucine, l-lysine, l-methionine, l-phenylalanine, l-threonine and l-valine.
Positive for β-galactosidase, arginine dihydrolase, tryptophan deaminase and acetoin production.
Negative for indole production, urease, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and hydrogen sulphide production.

Acid is not produced from glycerol, l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-adonitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, inositol, dulcitol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, d-lactose, melibiose, sucrose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, gentiobiose, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, l-fucose, d-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate or 5-ketogluconate.
Major isoprenoid quinone is Q-8, and the major fatty acids are iso-C17 : 1ω9c, iso-C17 : 0, iso-C15 : 0, C16 : 0 and iso-C17 : 0 3-OH.
Major polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, an unknown phospholipid, two unknown aminophospholipids and three unknown aminolipids.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 68.7 mol%.
The type strain, Gsoil 191T (=KCTC 12564T=DSM 17954T=CCUG 52462T), was isolated from soil from a ginseng field in Pocheon Province, South Korea.
